lead_paragraph: An American military spokesman said a “counterterrorism airstrike” had taken place in the area. Afghan officials said the victims were members of the Islamic State.

byline.contributor: Khalid Alokozay reported from Jalalabad, and Rod Nordland from Kabul, Afghanistan. Fahim Abed contributed reporting from Kabul.
byline.original: By KHALID ALOKOZAY and ROD NORDLAND

headline.print_headline: Airstrike in Afghanistan Kills at Least 13
headline.main: Airstrike in Eastern Afghanistan Kills at Least 13

snippet: An American military spokesman said a “counterterrorism airstrike” had taken place in the area. Afghan officials said the victims were members of the Islamic State....
abstract: Afghan officials say 13 people killed in airstrike in Nagarhar Province were members of Islamic State; Defense Dept spokesman says review of strike has been initiated in face of claims by residents that civilian casualties were involved.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
